Active python environment

Source: R/py_utils.R
py_active_env.Rd

Check for an active python environment without initialization. If none initialized, FALSE is returned. If an initialized environment is found, the env name based on reticulate::conda_list() will be returned. The following options will also be updated with information about the active environment:

  • "giotto.py_active_env" (envname)

  • "giotto.py_active_ver" (python version)

  • "giotto.py_active_path" (path to python)

Usage

py_active_env()

Value

boolean

Examples

py_active_env()
#> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘reticulate’
